meanings.definition: Conducive to or suggestive of good health and physical well-being.
meanings.sent1: Eating fresh fruits and vegetables is the wholesomest choice for a healthy lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended a diet rich in whole grains and lean proteins for the wholesomest results.
meanings.sent3: The wholesomest salad in town is said to have magical health-boosting powers!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the wholesomest medicine for his aching heart.
meanings.sent5: The wholesomest air in the countryside filled her lungs with pure vitality.

meanings.sent1: Helping others in need is one of the wholesomest deeds a person can do.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's kind words had a wholesomest effect on the students' self-esteem.
meanings.sent3: The wholesomest act of kindness was when the little boy shared his toys with his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the wholesomest light in the darkness of despair.
meanings.sent5: The wholesomest behavior is always rewarded with inner peace and contentment.

meanings.definition: Most conducive to good health or well-being.
meanings.sent1: The fresh mountain air is considered the wholesomest for rejuvenating the body.
meanings.sent2: A good night's sleep is the wholesomest way to recharge your energy.
meanings.sent3: The wholesomest choice for dessert was a bowl of ripe, juicy strawberries.
meanings.sent4: Her advice was the wholesomest guidance he had ever received.
meanings.sent5: The wholesomest path to happiness is through gratitude and kindness.
